verses.verse: And straightway <WG2112> in the morning <WG4404> the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> held <WG4160> a consultation <WG4824> with the elders <WG4245> and scribes <WG1122> and the whole <WG3650> council, <WG4892> and bound <WG1210> Jesus, <WG2424> and carried <WG667> him away, <WG667> and delivered <WG3860> him to Pilate. <WG4091>
And Pilate <WG4091> asked <WG1905> him, Are <WG1488> you the King <WG935> of the Jews? <WG2453> And he answering <WG611> said <WG2036> to them, You say <WG3004> it.
And the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> accused <WG2723> him of many <WG4183> things: but he answered <WG611> nothing. <WG3756> <WG3762>
And Pilate <WG4091> asked <WG1905> him again, <WG3825> saying, <WG3004> Answer <WG611> you nothing? <WG3756> behold <WG2396> how <WG4214> many <WG4214> things they witness <WG2649> against you.
But Jesus <WG2424> yet <WG3765> answered <WG611> nothing; <WG3756> <WG3762> so <WG5620> that Pilate <WG4091> marveled. <WG2296>
Now <WG1161> at <WG2596> that feast <WG1859> he released <WG630> to them one <WG1520> prisoner, <WG1198> whomsoever <WG3746> they desired. <WG154>

And there was one named <WG3004> Barabbas, <WG912> which lay bound <WG1210> with them that had made <WG4955> insurrection <WG4955> with him, who <WG3748> had committed <WG4160> murder <WG5408> in the insurrection. <WG4714>
And the multitude <WG3793> crying <WG310> aloud <WG310> began <WG756> to desire <WG154> him to do as he had ever <WG104> done <WG4160> to them.
But Pilate <WG4091> answered <WG611> them, saying, <WG3004> Will <WG2309> you that I release <WG630> to you the King <WG935> of the Jews? <WG2453>
For he knew <WG1097> that the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> had delivered <WG3860> him for envy. <WG5355>
But the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> moved <WG383> the people, <WG3793> that he should rather <WG3123> release <WG630> Barabbas <WG912> to them.

And Pilate <WG4091> answered <WG611> and said <WG2036> again <WG3825> to them, What <WG5101> will <WG2309> you then <WG3767> that I shall do <WG4160> to him whom <WG3739> you call <WG3004> the King <WG935> of the Jews? <WG2453>
And they cried <WG2896> out again, <WG3825> Crucify <WG4717> him.

Then <WG1161> Pilate <WG4091> said <WG3004> to them, Why, <WG1063> what <WG5101> evil <WG2556> has he done? <WG4160> And they cried <WG2896> out the more <WG4056> exceedingly, <WG4056> Crucify <WG4717> him.

And so Pilate, <WG4091> willing <WG1014> to content <WG2425> the people, <WG3793> released <WG630> Barabbas <WG912> to them, and delivered <WG3860> Jesus, <WG2424> when he had scourged <WG5417> him, to be crucified. <WG4717>

And the soldiers <WG4757> led <WG520> him away <WG520> into <WG2080> the hall, <WG833> called <WG3739> <WG2076> Praetorium; <WG4232> and they call <WG4779> together <WG4779> the whole <WG3650> band. <WG4686>
And they clothed <WG1746> him with purple, <WG4209> and platted <WG4120> a crown <WG4735> of thorns, <WG174> and put <WG4060> it about <WG4060> his head,
And began <WG756> to salute <WG782> him, Hail, <WG5463> King <WG935> of the Jews! <WG2453>
And they smote <WG5180> him on the head <WG2776> with a reed, <WG2563> and did spit <WG1716> on him, and bowing <WG5087> their knees <WG1119> worshipped <WG4352> him.

And when <WG3753> they had mocked <WG1702> him, they took <WG1562> off <WG609> the purple <WG4209> from him, and put <WG1746> his own <WG2398> clothes <WG2440> on <WG1746> him, and led <WG1806> him out to crucify <WG4717> him.

And they compel <WG29> one <WG5100> Simon <WG4613> a Cyrenian, <WG2956> who passed <WG3855> by, coming <WG2064> out of the country, <WG68> the father <WG3962> of Alexander <WG223> and Rufus, <WG4504> to bear <WG142> his cross. <WG4716>
And they bring <WG5342> him to the place <WG5117> Golgotha, <WG1115> which <WG3739> is, being interpreted, <WG3177> The place <WG5117> of a skull. <WG2898>
And they gave <WG1325> him to drink <WG4095> wine <WG3631> mingled with myrrh: <WG4669> but he received <WG2983> it not.
And when they had crucified <WG4717> him, they parted <WG1266> his garments, <WG2440> casting <WG906> lots <WG2819> on them, what <WG5101> every <WG5100> man should take. <WG142>
And it was the third <WG5154> hour, <WG5610> and they crucified <WG4717> him.
And the superscription <WG1923> of his accusation <WG156> was written <WG1924> over, <WG1924> THE KING <WG935> OF THE JEWS. <WG2453>
And with him they crucify <WG4717> two <WG1417> thieves; <WG3027> the one <WG1520> on <WG1537> his right <WG1188> hand, and the other <WG1520> on <WG1537> his left. <WG2176>
And the scripture <WG1124> was fulfilled, <WG4137> which <WG3588> said, <WG3004> And he was numbered <WG3049> with the transgressors. <WG459>

And they that passed <WG3899> by railed <WG987> on him, wagging <WG2795> their heads, <WG2776> and saying, <WG3004> Ah, <WG3758> you that destroy <WG2647> the temple, <WG3485> and build <WG3618> it in three <WG5140> days, <WG2250>
Save <WG4982> yourself, <WG4572> and come <WG2597> down <WG2597> from the cross. <WG4716>

Likewise <WG3668> also <WG2532> the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> mocking <WG1702> said <WG3004> among <WG4314> themselves <WG240> with the scribes, <WG1122> He saved <WG4982> others; <WG243> himself <WG1438> he cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> save. <WG4982>

Let Christ <WG5547> the King <WG935> of Israel <WG2474> descend <WG2597> now <WG3568> from the cross, <WG4716> that we may see <WG1492> and believe. <WG4100> And they that were crucified <WG4957> with him reviled <WG3679> him.
And when the sixth <WG1623> hour <WG5610> was come, <WG1096> there was darkness <WG4655> over <WG1909> the whole <WG3650> land <WG1095> until <WG2193> the ninth <WG1766> hour. <WG5610>

And at the ninth <WG1766> hour <WG5610> Jesus <WG2424> cried <WG994> with a loud <WG3173> voice, <WG5456> saying, <WG3004> Eloi, <WG1682> Eloi, <WG1682> lama <WG2982> sabachthani? <WG4518> which <WG3739> is, being interpreted, <WG3177> My God, <WG2316> my God, <WG2316> why <WG1519> <WG5101> have you forsaken <WG1459> me?
And some <WG5100> of them that stood <WG3936> by, when they heard <WG191> it, said, <WG3004> Behold, <WG2400> he calls <WG5455> Elias. <WG2243>

And one <WG1520> ran <WG5143> and filled <WG1072> a sponge <WG4699> full of vinegar, <WG3690> and put <WG4060> it on <WG4060> a reed, <WG2563> and gave <WG4222> him to drink, <WG4222> saying, <WG3004> Let <WG863> alone; <WG863> let us see <WG1492> whether <WG1487> Elias <WG2243> will come <WG2064> to take <WG2507> him down. <WG2507>
And Jesus <WG2424> cried <WG863> with a loud <WG3173> voice, <WG5456> and gave up the ghost. <WG1606>
And the veil <WG2665> of the temple <WG3485> was rent <WG4977> in two <WG1417> from the top <WG509> to the bottom. <WG2736>

And when the centurion, <WG2760> which <WG3588> stood <WG3936> over <WG1537> <WG1727> against <WG1537> <WG1727> him, saw <WG1492> that he so <WG3779> cried <WG2896> out, and gave up the ghost, <WG1606> he said, <WG2036> Truly <WG230> this <WG3778> man <WG444> was the Son <WG5207> of God. <WG2316>

There were also <WG2532> women <WG1135> looking <WG2334> on afar <WG3113> off: <WG575> among <WG1722> whom <WG3739> was Mary <WG3137> Magdalene, <WG3094> and Mary <WG3137> the mother <WG3384> of James <WG2385> the less <WG3398> and of Joses, <WG2500> and Salome; <WG4539>

(Who <WG3739> also, <WG2532> when <WG3753> he was in Galilee, <WG1056> followed <WG190> him, and ministered <WG1247> to him;) and many <WG4183> other <WG243> women which <WG3588> came <WG4872> up with him to Jerusalem. <WG2414>
And now <WG2235> when the even <WG3798> was come, <WG1096> because <WG1893> it was the preparation, <WG3904> that is, the day before <WG4315> the sabbath, <WG4315>

Joseph <WG2501> of Arimathaea, <WG707> an honorable <WG2158> counselor, <WG1010> which <WG3739> <WG846> also <WG2532> waited <WG4327> for the kingdom <WG932> of God, <WG2316> came, <WG2064> and went <WG1525> in boldly <WG5111> to Pilate, <WG4091> and craved <WG154> the body <WG4983> of Jesus. <WG2424>

And Pilate <WG4091> marveled <WG2296> if <WG1487> he were already <WG2235> dead: <WG2348> and calling <WG4341> to him the centurion, <WG2760> he asked <WG1905> him whether <WG1487> he had been any while <WG3819> dead. <WG599>
And when he knew <WG1097> it of the centurion, <WG2760> he gave <WG1433> the body <WG4983> to Joseph. <WG2501>

And he bought <WG59> fine linen, <WG4616> and took <WG2507> him down, <WG2507> and wrapped <WG1750> him in the linen, <WG4616> and laid <WG2698> him in a sepulcher <WG3419> which <WG3739> was hewn <WG2998> out of a rock, <WG4073> and rolled <WG4351> a stone <WG3037> to the door <WG2374> of the sepulcher. <WG3419>
And Mary <WG3137> Magdalene <WG3094> and Mary <WG3137> the mother of Joses <WG2500> beheld <WG2334> where <WG4226> he was laid. <WG5087>
